newsitem.title: JAPAN: TENNIS-PIERCE AND TAUZIAT PUT FRANCE AHEAD AGAINST JAPAN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-PIERCE AND TAUZIAT PUT FRANCE AHEAD AGAINST JAPAN.

text.p: Mary Pierce and Nathalie Tauziat gave France a 2-0 lead over Japan on the first day of their Fed Cup world group one tie on Saturday.
Australian Open finalist Pierce defeated Naoko Sawamatsu 6-0 7-6 while Tauziat, ranked 22nd in the world, beat Japan's top player Ai Sugiyama 4-6 7-5 6-4 in the first-round tie.

Sugiyama, 29th in the world, held matchpoint at 5-4 and 40-30 up in the second set but she allowed Tauziat to break her and the Frenchwoman won three games in a row to take the set and level the match.
Sugiyama will play Pierce on Sunday.
France, losing semifinalists in both the last two years, are captained by Yannick Noah, who has led the French men's team to the Davis Cup twice in the past five years.
